benchmark_details.name: GridRoute
benchmark_details.overview: GridRoute is a comprehensive benchmark designed to evaluate LLMs’ route planning abilities in grid-based environments, comparing independent prompting and algorithm-guided strategies.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of the benchmark is to systematically evaluate the role of traditional algorithmic guidance in enhancing the pathfinding capabilities of LLMs.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Performance of LLMs on ultra-large-scale maps remains unclear and requires extended experiments to assess trade-offs.

data.source: Randomly generated N×N grid environments with non-overlapping obstacles.
data.size: Various sizes with complexity: N=10 (2 obstacles), N=20 (3 obstacles), N=30 (4 obstacles)
data.annotation: Tasks are annotated by ensuring that paths adhere to grid movement constraints.

methodology.calculation: Ratios are computed based on the number of compliant and feasible paths over total cases.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values indicate better compliance, feasibility, and optimality of the path generated by LLMs.
methodology.baseline_results: Results are compared against paths calculated using Dijkstra's algorithm.
methodology.validation: Performance evaluated via metrics capturing correctness, optimality, and efficiency.
